Description: Stamp (vessel): mikyala. Measure of katam. Six line Kufic inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Miles, G.C. 1963. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ II (II. Peter Ruthven collection). New York, 18.

Stamps for katam are uncommon; besides the present type single examples are known of the Caliph Yazīd II, with Ḥayyān b. Shurayḥ, and of ʿUbaydāllāh b. al-Ḥabḥāb (Miles 1971, 6; Balog 1976, 108). Miles (1963, 18) has also noted the existence of a specimen of an anonymous type in a private collection. Bibliography: Miles, G.C. 1963. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ II (I. Benaki Museum: II. Peter Ruthven collection). New York; Miles, G.C. 1971. ‘Umayyad and ʿAbbasid glass weights and measure stamps in the Corning Museum’. Corning; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (157)
Associated names: Named in inscription: 'Abd al-Malik b. Marwān
